results.definition: a word or expression used for some particular thing

examples: he left school before the end of term

results.definition: (usually plural) a statement of what is required as part of an agreement
examples: the contract set out the conditions of the lease
the terms of the treaty were generous

results.definition: any distinct quantity contained in a polynomial
examples: the general term of an algebraic equation of the n-th degree

results.definition: one of the substantive phrases in a logical proposition
examples: the major term of a syllogism must occur twice

results.definition: the end of gestation or point at which birth is imminent
examples: a healthy baby born at full term

results.definition: (architecture) a statue or a human bust or an animal carved out of the top of a square pillar; originally used as a boundary marker in ancient Rome
name formally or designate with a term
